english: not have; without; not; to sink

etymology.interpretation: Water provides the meaning domain of liquids and submerging. The phonetic 𠬛 cues the historical sound that developed into modern readings méi/mò, linking senses like “to sink” and the negating usage via 没(有).
etymology.simplification: Traditional 沒 was simplified to 没 by reducing strokes in the phonetic component, streamlining the right side while retaining the water element.

examples.chinese: 今天没下雨(今天沒下雨)。
太阳落山后，船慢慢没入水中(太陽落山後，船慢慢沒入水中)。
examples.pinyin: Tàiyáng luòshān hòu, chuán mànmàn mòrù shuǐzhōng.
examples.english: After sunset, the boat slowly sank into the water.
